main event: A ground-visual observation of a UFO was reported at Mitchel AFB, N.Y. on 6th February 1959 for a duration of 30 minutes. The object was described as a steady light moving from west to north in a circular motion.
interesting points: The observation was thought to be too long for an aircraft or a balloon under the prevailing wind conditions, suggesting the possibility of a reflection on a cloud.
The observer, a weather observer at Mitchel AFB, reported the UFO as a steady light that was too high for a marker and too steady for a weather balloon or airplane.
The UFO was tracked using a theodolite for azimuth and elevation angles, providing precise observational data.
The clear visibility of 15 miles allowed for detailed observation of the UFO's movements.
The airdrome officer on duty, Captain Henri F. Fletcher, provided no comment on the UFO sighting.
sighted object: One white light moving from west to north in a circular motion
witnesses: Weather observer at Mitchel AFB, Captain Henri F. Fletcher
